creator: stanescuflorentina@gmail.com
text: I am trying to display an excel file created with apache poi on Mac 10.
You need to upgrade to a newer version of Apache POI, and use the shared strings table option. (Well, either that or persuade Apple to correctly follow the spec...)
creator: apache@gagravarr.org
stanescuflorentina@gmail.com
text:
I have tried the solution you proposed and it worked. 
Still i have 2 more questions :
1. XSSFWorkbook uses shared strings table, but seems to have performance issues when large spreadsheets need to be produced. 
- SXSSFWorkbook should be used when very large spreadsheets have to be produced but does not use shared strings table.

Can i configure SXSSFWorkbook to use shared string table? 

2. Columns with General data format that contains values TRUE or FALSE still do not display at all on Mac even if the excel is built with shared strings table.

As already stated, you need to upgrade if you want to use shared strings tables with sxssf

No idea about #2, I would suggest you produce examples with xssf which work and sxssf that don't, including code and screenshots, and open a new bug for the true/false issue
creator: apache@gagravarr.org
stanescuflorentina@gmail.com
text:
Thank you, i succeeded to fix the defect by using SXSSFWorkbook configured with shared strings table option. 

I'll add another defect for the true/false issue.
